@metadata.goal: The student can recognize and identify equal versus unequal parts

steps.dialogue: Which chocolate bar is partitioned into equal parts so each piece is exactly the same?

prompt.text: Select the bar with all equal parts

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look for the bar where all pieces are exactly the same size.

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar1
events.description: Bar 1 sections pulse sequentially, with largest and smallest pieces pulsing to show size difference

events.name: glow_equal_sections_bar2
events.description: Bar 2 sections glow together to show they are all the same size

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar3
events.description: Bar 3 sections pulse sequentially, with largest and smallest pieces pulsing to show size difference

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar4
events.description: Bar 4 sections pulse sequentially, with largest and smallest pieces pulsing to show size difference

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar1][event:glow_equal_sections_bar2][event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar3][event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar4]Let's think about this together. Equal parts means every piece is the same size. Look closely at each bar to compare the pieces.

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar1
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between smallest and largest pieces

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar2
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines confirming all sections are equal width, with checkmarks appearing on each piece

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar3
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between smallest and largest pieces

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar4
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between smallest and largest pieces

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_unequal_bar1][event:measure_sections_equal_bar2][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar3][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar4]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. We need to find the bar where all pieces are exactly the same size. Let's check each bar. Bar 1 has pieces of different sizes - see how some are bigger than others? Bar 3 and Bar 4 also have unequal pieces. But Bar 2 has all equal pieces - each section is exactly the same. That's how equal parts work - every piece must be the same size.

on_correct.dialogue: You identified the bar with equal sixths.

@metadata.goal: The student can recognize and identify equal versus unequal parts

steps.dialogue: A baker made different bread loaves with partition lines. Which loaves are cut into equal parts?

prompt.text: Select all bars showing equal parts

step.dialogue: Check each loaf carefully. Equal parts means all pieces are the same size.

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_1
events.description: All four equal sections glow together to show uniformity

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse alternately to show size difference

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_3
events.description: All eight equal sections glow together to show uniformity

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_4
events.description: Both equal halves glow together to show uniformity

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_5
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse alternately to show size difference

step.dialogue: [event:glow_equal_parts_bar_1][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2][event:glow_equal_parts_bar_3][event:glow_equal_parts_bar_4][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_5]Let's think about this together. Equal parts are all the same size. Look at each loaf and compare the pieces within it.

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_1
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing all four sections are identical width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_2
events.description: Animated measurement lines highlight different widths between sections

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_3
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing all eight sections are identical width

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_4
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing both halves are identical width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_5
events.description: Animated measurement lines highlight different widths between sections

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_equal_bar_1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_2][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_3][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_4][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_5]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. Equal parts means every piece in that loaf is exactly the same size. Let me show you each one. These three loaves have equal parts - all pieces match perfectly. The other two have unequal parts - some pieces are bigger than others. That's how we identify equal versus unequal parts.

on_correct.dialogue: You identified all the bars with equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can recognize and identify equal versus unequal parts

steps.dialogue: Some of these bars are divided into equal parts, and some aren't. Find all the bars where every part is the same size.

prompt.text: Select all bars with equal parts

step.dialogue: Check each bar carefully. Are all the parts in each bar the same size?

events.name: glow_sections_together_bar_1
events.description: All sections of bar_1 glow together to show they are equal

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse to show size difference

events.name: glow_sections_together_bar_3
events.description: All sections of bar_3 glow together to show they are equal

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_4
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse to show size difference

events.name: glow_sections_together_bar_5
events.description: All sections of bar_5 glow together to show they are equal

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_6
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse to show size difference

step.dialogue: [event:glow_sections_together_bar_1][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2][event:glow_sections_together_bar_3][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_4][event:glow_sections_together_bar_5][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_6]Let's think about this together. Equal parts means every section is exactly the same size. Look at how the parts compare in each bar.

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_1
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing all sections are equal width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_2
events.description: Measurement lines highlight size differences between sections

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_3
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing all sections are equal width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_4
events.description: Measurement lines highlight size differences between sections

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_5
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing all sections are equal width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_6
events.description: Measurement lines highlight size differences between sections

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_equal_bar_1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_2][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_3][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_4][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_5][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_6]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. We need bars where every part is exactly the same size. Bar 1 has three equal parts - they're all the same. Bar 2 has unequal parts - see how some are bigger? Bar 3 has six equal parts. Bar 4 has unequal parts. Bar 5 has four equal parts. Bar 6 has unequal parts. So bars 1, 3, and 5 all have equal parts.

on_correct.dialogue: You identified all the bars with equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can recognize and identify equal versus unequal parts

steps.dialogue: You need to find the bar that's correctly divided into eighths. Which one has 8 equal parts?

prompt.text: Select the bar divided into eighths

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look for the bar with 8 equal parts.

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_1
events.description: Bar 1's 8 equal sections glow together to show uniformity

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2
events.description: Bar 2's largest and smallest sections pulse to show size differences

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_3
events.description: Bar 3's 6 equal sections glow together

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_4
events.description: Bar 4's 4 equal sections glow together

step.dialogue: [event:glow_equal_parts_bar_1][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2][event:glow_equal_parts_bar_3][event:glow_equal_parts_bar_4]Let's think about this together. For eighths, you need exactly 8 parts that are all the same size. Check each bar carefully.

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_1
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines confirming all 8 sections are equal width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_2
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between the 8 sections

events.name: count_sections_bar_3
events.description: Numbers 1-6 appear sequentially over each section to show only 6 parts

events.name: count_sections_bar_4
events.description: Numbers 1-4 appear sequentially over each section to show only 4 parts

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_equal_bar_1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_2][event:count_sections_bar_3][event:count_sections_bar_4]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. We need 8 equal parts for eighths. Bar 1 has 8 parts that are all the same size. Bar 2 has 8 parts, but they're not equal. Bar 3 has only 6 parts, and Bar 4 has only 4 parts. That's why Bar 1 is divided into eighths.

on_correct.dialogue: You identified the bar with 8 equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can recognize and identify equal versus unequal parts

steps.dialogue: A ribbon is being cut into sixths. Find the bar where all six parts are exactly the same size.

prompt.text: Select the bar correctly partitioned into sixths

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look for the bar with six equal parts.

events.name: sections_glow_together_bar_1
events.description: All six equal sections glow together in unison

events.name: largest_smallest_pulse_bar_2
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse alternately to show size differences

events.name: sections_glow_together_bar_3
events.description: All three equal sections glow together, but only three sections visible

events.name: sections_glow_together_bar_4
events.description: All eight equal sections glow together, but eight sections visible

step.dialogue: [event:sections_glow_together_bar_1][event:largest_smallest_pulse_bar_2][event:sections_glow_together_bar_3][event:sections_glow_together_bar_4]Let's think about this together. We need six parts that are all exactly the same size. Watch as each bar highlights to show which parts are equal.

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_1
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines confirming all six sections are equal width, with checkmark appearing

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_2
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between the six sections

events.name: count_sections_bar_3
events.description: Numbers 1, 2, 3 appear sequentially over sections showing only three parts

events.name: count_sections_bar_4
events.description: Numbers 1-8 appear sequentially over sections showing eight parts

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_equal_bar_1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_2][event:count_sections_bar_3][event:count_sections_bar_4]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. We need exactly six parts, and they all need to be the same size. Let me show you each bar. This first bar has six parts, and watch how they're all equal. The second bar has six parts, but they're different sizes. The third bar only has three parts. The fourth bar has eight parts. So the first bar is the one with six equal parts. That's how sixths work - six equal parts make the whole.

on_correct.dialogue: You identified the bar with six equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can recognize and identify equal versus unequal parts

steps.dialogue: A carpenter marked wood boards with different partition lines. Which boards are divided into equal parts?

prompt.text: Select all bars showing equal parts

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look carefully at which boards have all sections the same size.

events.name: glow_sections_equal_bar_1
events.description: All three equal sections glow together to show they match

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse to show size difference

events.name: glow_sections_equal_bar_3
events.description: All six equal sections glow together to show they match

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_4
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse to show size difference

events.name: glow_sections_equal_bar_5
events.description: All eight equal sections glow together to show they match

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_6
events.description: Largest and smallest sections pulse to show size difference

step.dialogue: [event:glow_sections_equal_bar_1][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2][event:glow_sections_equal_bar_3][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_4][event:glow_sections_equal_bar_5][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_6]Let's think about this together. Equal parts means every section is exactly the same size. Check each board - do all its pieces match?

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_1
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing all three sections are identical width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_2
events.description: Measurement lines appear highlighting different widths between sections

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_3
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing all six sections are identical width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_4
events.description: Measurement lines appear highlighting different widths between sections

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_5
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing all eight sections are identical width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_6
events.description: Measurement lines appear highlighting different widths between sections

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_equal_bar_1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_2][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_3][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_4][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_5][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_6]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. For equal parts, every section must be the same size. The first board has three equal thirds - all match. The second board's sections are different sizes - not equal. The third board has six equal sixths. The fourth board has unequal sections. The fifth board has eight equal eighths. The sixth board has unequal thirds. So boards one, three, and five show equal parts.

on_correct.dialogue: You identified all the bars with equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can recognize and identify equal versus unequal parts

steps.dialogue: Look closely at these bars. Some are divided into equal parts, some aren't. Click all the ones with equal parts.

prompt.text: Click all bars showing equal parts

step.dialogue: Check each bar carefully. Are all the parts the same size?

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_1
events.description: Bar 1's equal sections glow together to show they match

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2
events.description: Bar 2's largest and smallest sections pulse to show size difference

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_3
events.description: Bar 3's equal sections glow together to show they match

events.name: glow_equal_parts_bar_4
events.description: Bar 4's equal sections glow together to show they match

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bar_5
events.description: Bar 5's largest and smallest sections pulse to show size difference

step.dialogue: [event:glow_equal_parts_bar_1][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_2][event:glow_equal_parts_bar_3][event:glow_equal_parts_bar_4][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bar_5]Let's think about this together. Equal parts means every section is exactly the same size. Look at each bar - do all sections match?

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_1
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing both sections of bar 1 are equal width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_2
events.description: Animated measurement lines highlight the different widths in bar 2's sections

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_3
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing all four sections of bar 3 are equal width

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar_4
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing all six sections of bar 4 are equal width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_5
events.description: Animated measurement lines highlight the different widths in bar 5's sections

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_equal_bar_1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_2][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_3][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_4][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_5]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. We need bars where every part is the same size. Bar 1 has 2 equal halves - both match perfectly. Bar 3 has 4 equal fourths - all the same. Bar 4 has 6 equal sixths - every section matches. But bar 2 and bar 5 have parts that are different sizes, so they're not equal. That's how we identify equal parts - every section must be exactly the same size.

on_correct.dialogue: You identified all the bars with equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can identify and maintain the whole when working with fractions

steps.dialogue: Look at this ribbon. Some sections are shaded to show the parts used for a project. How many equal parts does the whole ribbon have?

prompt.text: Count the total equal parts in the whole ribbon

step.dialogue: Count all the parts in the whole ribbon, not just the shaded ones.

events.name: pulse_all_sections
events.description: All eight sections of the ribbon pulse sequentially from left to right to emphasize counting the entire whole

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_all_sections]Let's think about this together. The whole ribbon includes both the shaded parts and the unshaded parts. Count every section from end to end.

events.name: count_all_sections
events.description: Animated counting overlay appears on each section sequentially with numbers 1-8, highlighting both shaded and unshaded sections to demonstrate counting the entire whole

step.dialogue: [event:count_all_sections]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. The whole ribbon means every part, whether it's shaded or not. Let's count together: one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight. The whole ribbon has 8 equal parts. That's how we identify the whole - we count all the parts together.

on_correct.dialogue: You counted all the parts in the whole ribbon.

@metadata.goal: The student can identify and maintain the whole when working with fractions

steps.dialogue: Here's a bookshelf showing reading progress. Some parts are shaded for books read. Count all the equal parts in the whole bar.

prompt.text: Count the total equal parts in the whole bar

step.dialogue: Count all the parts in the whole bar, both shaded and unshaded.

events.name: pulse_all_sections
events.description: All sections of the bar pulse sequentially from left to right to emphasize counting all parts

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_all_sections]Let's think about this together. The whole bar includes both the shaded parts and the unshaded parts. Count every section from left to right.

events.name: overlay_counting
events.description: Animated counting overlay appears on each section sequentially, numbering 1 through 8 from left to right across all sections

step.dialogue: [event:overlay_counting]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. The whole bar has 8 equal parts total. Let's count them: 1, 2, 3 are shaded, then 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 are unshaded. That's 8 parts in the whole. See how the whole includes all sections, not just the shaded ones.

on_correct.dialogue: You counted all the parts in the whole bar.

@metadata.goal: The student can identify and maintain the whole when working with fractions

steps.dialogue: Look at this garden row. Some sections show where vegetables are planted. Count all the equal parts in the whole row.

prompt.text: Count the total equal parts in the whole bar

step.dialogue: Count all the sections in the whole row, not just the planted ones.

events.name: pulse_all_sections
events.description: All six sections of bar_1 pulse together to emphasize counting the entire whole

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_all_sections]Let's think about this together. The whole row includes both the planted sections and the empty sections. Count every part from end to end.

events.name: count_sections_sequentially
events.description: Animated counting overlay appears on each section sequentially from left to right, displaying numbers 1 through 6 as each section highlights in turn

step.dialogue: [event:count_sections_sequentially]This is tricky, so let's work through it together. When we count parts in the whole, we count every section - both planted and empty. Let's count: one, two, three, four, five, six. The whole row has 6 equal parts total. That's how fractions work - the whole includes all the parts, not just the shaded ones.

on_correct.dialogue: You counted all the parts in the whole row.

@metadata.goal: The student can identify and maintain the whole when working with fractions

steps.dialogue: This sidewalk path has chalk drawings on some sections. Count all the equal parts in the whole path.

prompt.text: Count the total equal parts in the whole bar

step.dialogue: Count all the sections in the whole path, not just the chalk drawings.

events.name: pulse_all_sections
events.description: All 8 sections of the bar pulse sequentially from left to right to emphasize counting the complete whole

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_all_sections]Let's think about this together. The whole path includes both the chalk drawings and the plain sections. Count every section from end to end.

events.name: overlay_counting
events.description: Animated overlay shows numbers 1-8 appearing sequentially above each section as they are counted, with a final emphasis on '8 equal parts total'

step.dialogue: [event:overlay_counting]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. When we count parts in the whole, we count every section - both the chalk drawings and the plain ones. Let's count from left to right: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8. The whole path has 8 equal parts. That's how fractions work - the whole includes all parts, not just the shaded ones.

on_correct.dialogue: You counted all the parts in the whole bar.

@metadata.goal: The student can understand that all parts must be equal for unit fractions

steps.dialogue: A chocolate bar is divided into sixths, with one piece shaded. Which bar shows the correct way to divide it into sixths?

prompt.text: Select the bar showing the correct fraction

step.dialogue: Not quite. Look for the bar where all six pieces are the same size.

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar1
events.description: Bar 1 sections pulse sequentially, showing largest and smallest pieces to highlight inequality

events.name: glow_equal_sections_bar2
events.description: Bar 2 sections glow together to show all parts are equal

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar3
events.description: Bar 3 sections pulse sequentially, showing largest and smallest pieces to highlight inequality

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar4
events.description: Bar 4 sections pulse sequentially, showing largest and smallest pieces to highlight inequality

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar1][event:glow_equal_sections_bar2][event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar3][event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar4]Let's think about this together. For sixths, all six parts need to be equal. Look closely at which bar has pieces that are all the same size.

events.name: measure_sections_equal_bar2
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines confirming all six sections are equal width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar1
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between sections

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar3
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between sections

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar4
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between sections

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_equal_bar2][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar3][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar4]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. For a fraction like [fraction numerator=1 denominator=6]one sixth[/fraction], we need six equal parts. Let me show you - bar 2 has all six pieces the same size, so that's the correct one. See how all six parts are equal? That's what makes it sixths.

on_correct.dialogue: You found the bar with six equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can understand that all parts must be equal for unit fractions

steps.dialogue: Jamie divided a fruit bar into 8 pieces. Each person gets one piece. Which bar shows pieces that are truly equal?

prompt.text: Select the bar showing the correct fraction

step.dialogue: Check if all 8 pieces are the same size.

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_top
events.description: The largest and smallest pieces in the top bar pulse to show size differences

events.name: glow_equal_parts
events.description: All sections in the middle bar glow together to show they are equal

events.name: pulse_largest_smallest_bottom
events.description: The largest and smallest pieces in the bottom bar pulse to show size differences

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_largest_smallest_top][event:glow_equal_parts][event:pulse_largest_smallest_bottom]Let's think about this together. For fractions to work, all parts need to be equal. Look closely at each bar's pieces.

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_top
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing the width differences between sections in the top bar

events.name: measure_sections_equal
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing all sections in the middle bar are exactly the same width

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bottom
events.description: Animated measurement lines appear showing the width differences between sections in the bottom bar

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_unequal_top][event:measure_sections_equal][event:measure_sections_unequal_bottom]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. For eighths to be fair, all 8 pieces must be exactly the same size. The top and bottom bars have uneven pieces - some are bigger than others. Only the middle bar has all 8 pieces equal. That's how eighths work - 8 equal parts make the whole.

on_correct.dialogue: You found the bar with 8 equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can understand that all parts must be equal for unit fractions

steps.dialogue: Three friends are sharing a brownie equally. Which bar shows that each friend gets exactly [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]one third[/fraction]?

prompt.text: Select the bar showing the correct fraction

step.dialogue: Not quite. For [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]one third[/fraction], all three parts must be exactly the same size.

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar1
events.description: Bar 1 sections pulse sequentially showing size differences between parts

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar2
events.description: Bar 2 sections pulse sequentially showing size differences between parts

events.name: glow_equal_sections
events.description: Bar 3 sections glow together showing all parts are equal

events.name: pulse_unequal_sections_bar4
events.description: Bar 4 sections pulse sequentially showing size differences between parts

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar1][event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar2][event:glow_equal_sections][event:pulse_unequal_sections_bar4]Let's think about this together. For equal sharing, each friend needs the exact same amount. Look for the bar where all three sections are identical.

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar1
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences, with smallest and largest sections pulsing

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar2
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences, with smallest and largest sections pulsing

events.name: measure_sections_equal
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines confirming all three sections are equal width, with checkmarks appearing on each section

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar4
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences, with smallest and largest sections pulsing

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_unequal_bar1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar2][event:measure_sections_equal][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar4]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. For [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]one third[/fraction], we need exactly 3 equal parts. Let me show you each bar. These bars have unequal parts - some pieces are bigger than others. But this bar has all three parts exactly the same size. That's how thirds work - 3 equal parts make the whole.

on_correct.dialogue: You found the bar with equal parts showing [fraction numerator=1 denominator=3]one third[/fraction].

@metadata.goal: The student can understand that all parts must be equal for unit fractions

events.name: measure_sections_unequal_bar_4
events.description: Animated overlay showing measurement lines highlighting size differences between sections

step.dialogue: [event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_1][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_2][event:measure_sections_equal_bar_3][event:measure_sections_unequal_bar_4]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. To show fourths correctly, we need all four parts to be exactly the same size. Let me show you each bar. Bars 1, 2, and 4 have parts that are different sizes - some bigger, some smaller. But bar 3 has all four parts the same size. That's how fourths work - all parts must be equal.

on_correct.dialogue: You identified the bar with equal fourths.
